title: spec: easy way to get const name from it's value.
body:
Considering the following code in: http://play.golang.org/p/tW909FaeAr

For debugging purposes, error logs, etc, I would like Go to have an easy way to return
me the constant name as string, through it's numeric value and type, without creating
those maps.

I'm not suggesting a pre-processor. I think this could work directly in the
compiler/runtime by mapping each name as a string value that could be retrieved in
runtime.

Please let me know if this is something that would cost more than working around it as
the example above, even in a large project with dozens of constants.
